benchmark_details.name: CoIN-Bench
benchmark_details.overview: CoIN-Bench is a new benchmark featuring the challenging multi-instance scenarios of Collaborative Instance Object Navigation (CoIN), supporting evaluation with both human and simulated user-agent interactions for reproducibility.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To facilitate the evaluation of the CoIN task by providing a benchmark that assesses the performance of navigation agents in multi-instance scenarios through human-agent dialogues.

data.source: Constructed as a filtered subset of the GOAT-Bench dataset focusing on multi-instance scenarios.

metrics: Success Rate weighted by Path Length (SPL)
methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the agent's performance in achieving the navigation goal and the amount of user interaction required.
methodology.interpretation: Higher SR indicates successful navigation to the target instance with fewer interactions.
methodology.baseline_results: AIUTA performs competitively against state-of-the-art Instance Object Navigation methods.
methodology.validation: Evaluated both through real human interactions and simulated interactions.
